programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: Up the Ante in El Monte
programme.desc: Brandi and Jarrod try to outwit their rivals at an auction in El Monte, but face disaster if their plan backfires.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones are in Hollywood, where despite stiff competition they hope to lay claim to film memorabilia, including an autographed Raging Bull poster.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones discover a 1970s mechanical bull and a banjo from the 1940s.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Jenny buys a storage unit that contains a locked safe - but she has no idea how to open it or what might be inside.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.sub-title: I'd Do Anything for Lesa (But I Won't Do That)
programme.desc: Jenny restores some old furniture, while tensions erupt between her, Lesa and Mary.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick and his team restore a vintage arcade boxing game.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick restores a famous car featured in the James Bond movie The Spy who Loved Me.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: Joe and Tommy take on double shifts as the contest enters the home stretch, but they and their rivals may be pushing themselves too far.

programme.title: Ernie the Wildman
programme.desc: Turtleman Ernie Brown Jr gets a call from a local feed store claiming that someone - or something - has been tearing open its bags of feed.

programme.title: Ernie the Wildman
programme.desc: Ernie Brown Jr comes to the aid of Rodney, whose cattle farm has been losing calves. Turtleman is out to help find the miscreant that has been butchering the livestock.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: An original Beach Boys surfboard, a magazine feature penned by Mark Twain, an early spirit hydrometer and an original Peter Max painting of the Statue of Liberty are assessed.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick and the gang encounter seeds that were sent into space, a spaceship toilet seat and a photo autographed by famous astronauts.

programme.title: UFO Europe
programme.desc: Strange lights, a government cover-up and something odd above the woods - experts revisit the Swedish Mora UFO photos, Mussolini's UFO files and the Rendlesham forest incident.

programme.title: UFO Europe
programme.desc: An Air France pilot and his crew see a huge object above Paris, UFOs are sighted over a quiet town in Portugal, and lone drivers in Denmark experience something very strange.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.sub-title: Who Wants to Be a Bazillionaire?
programme.desc: Don and the guys are in an industrial area of Toronto for an auction, and Roy hopes there will be some hidden treasures in the industrial lockers.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.desc: Father-and-son team Bogart and Paul argue over Paul's propensity to spend, while janitors Mike and Armando make an appearance at the auction.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz locate a 1947 Harley-Davidson Knucklehead, and are given VIP access to the untouched stash of a former antiques shop owner.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Franz pay another visit to Hobo Jack to see if there are any new finds in his junkyard.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Victor makes a find that leads him to a basketball arena, while another bidder is not so successful and left desperate for revenge.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Jenny acquires inside information on a prized locker - and when she opens it, she discovers it contains information on a centuries-old secret society.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Ricky and Bubba demonstrate they have a mean side as tensions rise during the last day of auctions in Austin.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders visit state capital Austin, where Moe and Mary compete for a locker worth $8,000

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders visit Mesquite, where Ricky and Bubba compete over a collection of antique horse-riding gear.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers attend auctions in Ponder, but face stiff competition from the locals, who seem to have inside knowledge on the contents of the lockers.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Pawn Stars revisit some of the most wicked items to ever come in the shop - a thermonuclear weapon warhead cover, a desk with a dark secret and a collection of knives.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Revisit some of the most expensive items in the shop as Pawn Stars splash the cash for a 1961 Fender Stratocaster guitar, Mickey Mouse display items and Star Wars memorabilia.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick and the gang encounter seeds that were sent into space, a spaceship toilet seat and a photo autographed by famous astronauts.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: An original Beach Boys surfboard, a magazine feature penned by Mark Twain, an early spirit hydrometer and an original Peter Max painting of the Statue of Liberty are assessed.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick checks out various curious items including a 19th-century Hobbs & Co lock box and an original Woody Woodpecker painting.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A 1769 set of playing cards with hidden political message shuffles into the shop. Also, Corey checks out a set of Charlie's Angels figurines.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A 1906 silver half dollar that belonged to a passenger on the Titanic is brought into the shop.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Chumlee checks out a Japanese animatronic monkey and wonders whether it is worth his time and effort.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick grapples over a decision when a WWE Hall of Fame ring hits the store.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A signed script from Seinfeld hits the store, while Chum and Corey go over a barrel for a vintage Donkey Kong arcade machine.

programme.title: Irish Pickers
programme.desc: Dublin dealer Ian Dowling and his mate Butzy search for treasures in Cork. Items include a mysterious stone head and a carving of a famous figure from Irish mythology.

programme.title: Paranormal: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: An Oregon man shoots some incredible Bigfoot footage, UFOs gather over Texas and an active poltergeist appears in Wales.

programme.title: Paranatural
programme.desc: A psychic in New Jersey claims she can see the murderer of a teenage girl, and another in Oregon tries to help solve the mysterious death of a cowboy.

programme.title: The Curse of Civil War Gold
programme.desc: With only one shot left to convince Marty to join their search, the team heads west where new clues are revealed.

programme.title: Pirate Traders
programme.desc: The race is on when a wealthy doctor seeks the Pirates' help in retrieving a medical chopper from a farm in Cartel country.

programme.title: Meet the Richardsons
programme.desc: The couple are thrilled when they are finally invited to Jonathan Ross's Halloween party, where Lucy is very excited to meet Jason Donovan.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain returns with a timely new run of the topical comedy show, with Angela Barnes, Ed Gamble, James Acaster, Milton Jones and Tez Ilyas joining regular panellist Hugh Dennis to take a comic look at what's been happening in the news through stand-up and improvised games.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Asim Chaudhry has fun with drainpipes, and Tim Vine gets stuck in a tunnel, and Greg Davies gives Alex Horne a sharp telling off.

programme.title: Porters
programme.desc: When surgeon extraordinaire Mr Pradeep is put under Simon's wing for the day, disaster ensues just as a cosplaying Orc fanatic is admitted into the hospital.

programme.title: Beat the Internet with John Robins
programme.desc: The comedian hosts as members of the public are pitted against each other in a quest to predict how search engines respond to a series of questions.

programme.title: Beat the Internet with John Robins
programme.desc: The comedian hosts as members of the public are pitted against each other in a quest to predict how search engines respond to a series of questions.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Aussie Pickers
programme.desc: Series following two pickers, Lucas Callaghan and Adam McDonald, who earn a living by restoring forgotten relics to their former glory, beginning with a visit to a junkyard.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond visits Abu Dhabi's Yas Marina circuit to drive the Porsche 918 Spyder, a four-wheel-drive hybrid hypercar capable of astonishing speeds thanks to the 886 horsepower it can generate from its screaming V8 petrol engine and electric motors. Jeremy Clarkson and James May join forces to create a public information film to promote safer cycling, with their efforts presented to a panel of experts including members of Westminster Council and Olympic gold medal-winning rider Chris Boardman. Meanwhile, Jeremy - who has promised to change his name to Jennifer if the Porsche is faster around the test track than the McLaren P1 driven earlier in the series - compares the seventh-generation Volkswagen Golf GTI to BMW's critically acclaimed M135i. Breaking Bad star Aaron Paul fires up the Reasonably Priced Car to see what lap time he can achieve.

programme.title: Aussie Pickers
programme.desc: Series following two pickers, Lucas Callaghan and Adam McDonald, who earn a living by restoring forgotten relics to their former glory, beginning with a visit to a junkyard.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys get their fill of petroliana at a pick in Vermont, and Frank and Dave head to Florida in search of a super-rare cycle car.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys land a major pick for Dolly Parton's theme park, Dollywood, but with just two weeks to find countless items, they'll need to work more than 9 to 5.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon and Lori head to an auction in Desert Hot Springs, California, and do their best to keep the competition at bay.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Lori and Kashuna go head to head at auction and bid for a vintage car and fishing tackle.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon and the Taylor brothers set their sights on some vintage military equipment.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon and Lori are pitted against the Taylors in San Pedro, where they bid on shipping containers worth a fortune.

programme.title: Border Interceptors
programme.desc: Armed police in Cork hunt for illegal immigrants trying to get into Ireland and officers in Dublin deal with a brother and sister from Hong Kong who claim to be visiting a relative.

programme.title: Border Interceptors
programme.desc: Traffic cops in Dublin pull over a driver suspected of drug offences, while a teenager arrives from France, travelling alone and unable to find those she is meant to be meeting.

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: A man kidnapped and beaten by a Mexican drug cartel flees across the bridge into America. At Progreso International Bridge, a woman is caught hiding anti-anxiety pills in her bra.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson subjects the Skoda Yeti to a thorough examination, while Richard Hammond charts the evolution of the Porsche 911 by pitting a modern Turbo S cabriolet against its oldest relative the Volkswagen Beetle - and the power of gravity. James May takes the Ariel Atom V8 for a spin on the test track, and comedian John Bishop receives tuition from the Stig before getting behind the wheel of the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May visit Albania to test three luxury vehicles - the Rolls-Royce Ghost, Bentley Mulsanne and Mercedes-Benz S65 AMG. Jeremy also drives three high-performance hatchbacks in the form of the limited-edition Ford Focus RS500, Prodrive-developed Cosworth Impreza STi CS400 and one-off Volvo C30 PPC. Jonathan Ross is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Olympic long jump champion Greg Rutherford, broadcaster Kirsty Young, actress-writer Joanna Scanlan and comedian Henning Wehn join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the panel show, trying to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Rob Brydon hosts.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Funnyman Jimmy Carr, actor and comedian Griff Rhys Jones, Hairy Biker Dave Myers and news presenter Susanna Reid join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the panel show, trying to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Rob Brydon hosts.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.sub-title: Would I Lie to You? The Unseen Bits
programme.desc: A compilation of extra material from the comedy panel show, hosted by Rob Brydon. Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by guests including Mel Giedroyc, Jason Manford, Sarah Millican, Stephen Mangan, Dermot O'Leary, Charles Dance, Warwick Davis, David Harewood, Bob Mortimer, David O'Doherty and Joanna Scanlan to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee and Lucy get a family pet in an attempt to teach the children to be more responsible. But as ever, things do not quite work out as planned. Domestic comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton, with a guest appearance from former EastEnders actress Annette Badland (Aunt Babe).

credits.actor: a guest appearance from former EastEndersAnnette Badland (Aunt Babe)

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee Mack and Sally Bretton star in the domestic comedy which sees the couple appear to go from one disaster to the next, while coping with their three kids, Lucy's disapproving parents, Lee's feckless dad Frank and their world-weary friends Toby and Anna. This week the couple become addicted to a TV box set, causing them to cancel dinner with Toby and Anna at the last moment. But when they lie about the reason, it only succeeds in opening up a huge can of worms. Domestic comedy, with Hugh Dennis and Abigail Cruttenden.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: A missing toy keyring leads to a rift between Lee and Lucy and their best friends and former neighbours Toby and Anna. Domestic comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton, with Hugh Dennis and Abigail Cruttenden.

programme.title: Hypothetical
programme.desc: Johnny Vegas, Zoe Lyons, Sara Pascoe and Richard Osman are posed increasingly absurd hypothetical situations. Hosted by Josh Widdicombe and James Acaster.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Terms and Conditions Apply
programme.desc: Using his trademark, powerpoint-comedy and a series of mischievous games, Dave invites three of the country's finest comic minds to help him make sense of our insensible world. In the first episode he is joined by Richard Osman, Phil Wang and Sara Barron, as they take a deep dive into the details we usually miss.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The spacecraft designed for the first manned mission to Mars, planned to launch by 2035, which requires the most powerful rocket ever built and a specially designed crew module.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A settlement in Argentina destroyed by floods, a town in the US that has been erased, and a Soviet dream-town that turned into a nuclear nightmare.

programme.title: WW2 - Battles for Europe
programme.desc: Examining the work of the American forces who launched a huge offensive to blast a gap in the German lines and break through to liberate France.

programme.title: The Normans
programme.desc: Professor Robert Bartlett examines the impact of the conquest of Britain and Ireland, and learns how William the Conqueror built scores of castles and cathedrals to impose his control and intimidate the population. The ruler also commissioned the Domesday Book to survey the wealth of the land and raise revenue, and set in motion the linguistic and cultural transformation of England. The Normans blended well in Scotland, but faced fierce opposition in Wales, and promoted divisions in Ireland which some claim still exist to this day.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Normans
programme.desc: Professor Robert Bartlett examines the Normans' expansion toward southern Europe and the Middle East in the 11th century. Southern Italy and Sicily were conquered and a prosperous kingdom flourished on the island, which became an important centre of medieval culture and an example of harmony between religions. However, Pope Urban II's call for holy war against the Muslims, to win Jerusalem back, led to the Normans embarking on the First Crusade.

programme.title: Napoleon: The Egyptian Campaign
programme.desc: Part one of two. The French general's 1798 military expedition to occupy Egypt, providing a base from which to attack English territory in the Indies.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: A secret weapons program in the heart of Austria that could have ended badly for the Allies - and may have indicated nuclear plans being concocted by Hitler.

programme.title: Private Lives
programme.desc: Dr Tracy Borman, Chief Curator at Historic Royal Palaces, travels to Paris to reveal Napoleon's relationships, from nervous first encounters with a prostitute to his all-consuming love for Josephine, his Empress consort. She visits the statesman and military leader's former home Malmaison and the Palace of Fontainebleau to view his throne room and reveals the secrets to his extraordinary success - and calamitous downfall.

programme.title: Private Lives
programme.desc: Chief Curator at Historic Royal Palaces, Dr Tracy Borman travels to Germany to uncover Nazi Party leader Adolf Hitler's abusive childhood and artistic aspirations. She reveals how he was shaped by the First World War and uncovers his relationships with much younger women, including his own niece, discovering how the personal motivations that came from his private life unleashed so much destruction.

programme.title: Private Lives
programme.desc: Dr Tracy Borman travels to St Petersburg, to reveal how Emperor Peter the Great's unconventional childhood produced a very unconventional man - from the debauched drinking society that governed Russia to his collection of oddities in the Kunstkamera museum. She also discovers how the enlightened yet brutal Peter managed to drag Russia towards the modern age.

programme.title: Private Lives
programme.desc: Dr Tracy Borman heads to Chicago to discover how Al Capone rose to infamy, from club bouncer to the most notorious gangster in history. She uncovers the two sides to his personality, as the man who ordered deaths on a whim doted on his family, and reveals how his carefully curated public image gave birth to a legend.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve and his team of explorers head to Greenland in the Arctic. Kayaking the world's largest fjord, they dodge giant icebergs and hungry polar bears.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve Backshall leads a team into Yucatan, Mexico on the trail of the ancient Maya. Uncovering sinister secrets and artefacts, they push far into the underworld of the Maya.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: The naturalist and explorer leads a team on a mission to summit a remote and unclimbed mountain in the Stauning Alps of Greenland, crossing a vast river and skiing across a glacier.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve and his team of explorers head to Greenland in the Arctic. Kayaking the world's largest fjord, they dodge giant icebergs and hungry polar bears.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve Backshall leads a team into Yucatan, Mexico on the trail of the ancient Maya. Uncovering sinister secrets and artefacts, they push far into the underworld of the Maya.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: The naturalist and explorer leads a team on a mission to summit a remote and unclimbed mountain in the Stauning Alps of Greenland, crossing a vast river and skiing across a glacier.

programme.title: The Rolling Stones at the BBC
programme.desc: A selection of the band's performances from the BBC archives, in a programme originally broadcast in 2012 to celebrate their 50th anniversary. Songs include The Last Time, Let's Spend The Night Together, Get Off of My Cloud, Honky Tonk Women, Gimme Shelter, Miss You and Start Me Up. Plus, footage of the band performing 19th Nervous Breakdown on Top of the Pops in 1966, which was used in a 1960s BBC documentary about women with depression.

programme.title: Tom Jones at the BBC
programme.desc: A celebration of the singer's performances, from the start of his career in the 1960s to his appearance on Later with Jools Holland just before he celebrated his 70th birthday in 2010. The programme includes archive footage of the Welshman's appearances on The Dusty Springfield Show and Top of the Pops.

programme.title: Royals on the Frontline
programme.desc: Prince Andrew discusses his stint in the Falklands and what it's really like to confront your own mortality, while Prince Edward's decision to quit his marine training is examined.

programme.title: Titanic: Stories from the Deep
programme.desc: Exploring the high cost of surviving the sinking, including the tragic story of Frederick Fleet, one of two lookouts, whose quick actions may have averted an even great disaster.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris takes a railway trip across Canada, revealing how 2,500 miles of transcontinental railway was built against huge odds in just a few decades, helping to join together a vast wilderness of isolated communities and create the country that exists today. He begins his journey on one of the earliest sections of track to be built, on a train that is now a lifeline for hunters and fishermen. He then sees one of the biggest, most famous trains in the world - the Canadian, before heading for the Prairies, and on to the port of Vancouver. Along the way he also searches for Winnie the Pooh, crosses raging rivers and meets the descendant of a pioneering Yorkshire family who arrived here more than 100 years ago.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Part one of two. A psychiatrist treating a disturbed woman on trial for killing her family asks the team to investigate possible links to a double murder committed three years ago. Enquiries lead to a mysterious man convincing mentally unstable women to kill. Paul Kaye, Laurence Penry-Jones and Lucy Gaskell guest star, with Trevor Eve and Sue Johnston.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Gary investigates the alleged rape of a 13-year-old girl and discovers she lied about her age. At his urging, the accused confess to sex, hoping to be treated leniently - only to end up facing a possible life sentence. Honey's fiance Scott Burnett is arrested for murdering his wife, while Ramani is interrogated by Adam and Gina about events leading up to Margaret Barnes' fall - and suffers the added trauma of learning Roger has accused her of deliberately causing the incident.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Maggie returns from Thailand with her new toy boy. Bayleaf is found not guilty in court, while Jean and Sicknote continue to get along swimmingly.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits the stunning Rowden Gardens on Dartmoor - one of the participants in the National Gardens Scheme.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Cadfael
programme.desc: A woman's corpse is discovered in a ploughed field, and the only lead is her husband, a potter. A year earlier, he suddenly decided to start a new life as a monk, suggesting that his wife may have committed suicide because she could not bear to lose him to the brethren - or that her spouse may have had a hand in her death. Medieval mystery, starring Derek Jacobi.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The Rev Harry Nettles bets the antiques dealer that a field next to a church contains a Roman mosaic. Drama, guest starring David Kossoff, with Ian McShane and Dudley Sutton.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The antiques dealer's teenage daughter goes missing, while an MP's son develops a profitable sideline in forged paintings. Drama, starring Ian McShane.

programme.title: Sharpe
programme.desc: Humiliated that Sir Henry Simmerson has allowed the French to make off with an English standard, Sharpe vows to make amends by capturing the most jealously guarded battlefield prize of them all - a French eagle emblem touched by the hand of Napoleon himself. Sean Bean, Daragh O'Malley and Brian Cox star.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: Work at Thornley Manor is over and the lads take a break before leaving for Spain. Oz uses the opportunity to visit home and hits on the barmy idea of kidnapping his son, determined to prevent him from being taken overseas by his wife Marjorie - but makes the mistake of roping Wayne in to help.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: Tempers fray as the boys' flight to Spain is postponed, so Ally Fraser tries to calm things down by inviting them all back to his flash residence for drinks - where Wayne's libido soon leads him into trouble. With Jimmy Nail, Gary Holton and Bill Paterson.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Horticultural lecturer Rosemary Boxer is hired by a wealthy but ill businessman to help cure a disease causing his trees to lose their bark. She gets to know Laura Thyme, who turns up after a friend is killed in a suspicious car accident, and when the pair find the lord of the manor unconscious beneath his bedroom window, they must decide whether depression led him to attempt suicide or if there is a more sinister explanation. Drama, starring Felicity Kendal, Pam Ferris, David Mallinson and Roger Alborough.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The amateur sleuths uncover the remains of a racehorse while engaged on horticultural work in the grounds of pop star Nev Connolly's supposedly haunted mansion. Before long, gruesome revelations are coming thick and fast as Nev is shot dead and more bones are discovered - this time belonging to a young woman. As they investigate further, Rosemary and Laura are plunged into a sinister mystery with roots deep in the past. Drama, guest starring Murray Head (Heartbeat) and Abigail Cruttenden (Benidorm).

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Laura and Rosemary are asked to restore an ornate water garden cascade in the grounds of a health spa, where they are invited to join owner Frances Caldecott and her children for dinner. That evening, the duo discover Frances has been strangled and her jewellery stolen, and set out to catch the culprit. Drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: Shepherd and his team are confronted with the sight of a Santa Claus with a slit throat. The victim is actually much-loved local mayor Evan Whitestone, who had dressed as Santa every year for the Christmas parade. Suspicion soon turns to the four rivals for his mayoral chains in a forthcoming election. Neill Rea and Fern Sutherland star.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: Murdoch helps an Italian detective recover a shipload of stolen antiquities and Brackenreid considers shipping out altogether.

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: Sequel to hit fantasy drama Life on Mars. Alex Drake, a single mother working as a police psychologist in 2008 is shocked to wake up in London in 1981 after being shot. DCI Gene Hunt, DS Ray Carling and DC Chris Skelton, transferred to the Met, swiftly come to her rescue. She knows all about the trio having spent months reading Sam Tyler's reports of his time in the past, but cannot understand why she is sharing his delusion. Starring Philip Glenister and Keeley Hawes.

programme.title: Ashes to Ashes
programme.desc: DCI Hunt is determined nothing will spoil Diana Spencer's wedding, and so sets out to prevent a potentially explosive protest getting out of hand. When it seems Thatcherite playboy Danny is in danger, Alex is assigned to look after him - but after a speedy ride in a DeLorean leaves her in no fit state for work, Gene and Ray set out to crack the case. Philip Glenister and Keeley Hawes star.

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: A woman asks Kavanagh to ensure justice is done on behalf of her husband, who died on the operating table in mysterious circumstances - despite the surgeon's claims that he was alive and well when she stitched him up. As if that were not a tough enough assignment, the redoubtable barrister also faces the task of convincing son Matt that failing his A levels is not the end of the world. John Thaw stars with his real-life wife Sheila Hancock, Josette Simon, Lisa Harrow and Tom Brodie.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: A family of five spanning three generations answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: The Home Game
programme.desc: A garden makeover aims to save a Devon mother from going potty, Plus, plans for a 'totally bling' Essex orangery have a woman seeing red, and a couple in Hampshire exceed their huge budget. Property rejuvenation show, presented by Linda Barker.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Danny takes on a BMX champion at the UK's national cycling centre. Can he win the race or will he get the cream pie forfeit?.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo is babysitting the Neighbours' toddler. The baby flees and kidnaps Fizz mistaking him for a plush toy..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Fizz has invented a machine which stops toast from landing butter-side down. Magoo sees some floating toast and believes a ghost is haunting their house..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo thinks he is on a beach and that sailors are emptying their oil tanker right into the ocean..

programme.title: Scrambled!
programme.desc: Two hours of children's fun and entertainment.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean accidentally spills all of Mrs. Wicket's new, expensive perfume on the floor. Can he hide the crime and cover his tracks?.

programme.title: Ben 10
programme.desc: Team Tennyson goes international in the Omni-Copter and the first stop is for a hike in the Scottish Highlands.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania
programme.desc: The monsters celebrate Bad Friday by trying to win the Screamie for the best scare.

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined in the kitchen by Wet Wet Wet singer Marti Pellow, chefs Brian Turner and Cherish Finden, and seafood expert Dan the Fish Man.

programme.title: Living on the Veg
programme.desc: Henry Firth and Ian Theasby serve up creamy seaside pie - their take on fish pie - and also prepare chilli and nachos, big burrito cake filled with sweet potatoes, smoky peppers and spicy rice, and finish off with their New York-style cheesecake topped with strawberries. Their guest is Rachel Ama, who cooks her harissa hotpot - aubergine cooked in a hot and spicy sauce.

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh surprises a group of senior citizens in Thornton Heath, turning an urban wasteland into a welcoming oasis of swaying grasses and pretty daisy flowers. The experts share tips on how to achieve the look of a miniature prairie even in a tiny space, the tricks to creating a cost-effective water feature from skip material, and how to choose the best low-maintenance shrubs to green up even the shadiest of spots.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Midsomer University science fellow George Jeffers threatens to make public a problem with his state-of-the-art invention Kernel Logic, which he believes is potentially lethal, but American software boss Clinton Finn fears he will lose millions if the truth comes out. When a schoolteacher is killed in a hit-and-run, Barnaby suspects Jeffers was the intended target. Detective drama, guest starring David Haig and Nigel Whitmey, with John Nettles and Jason Hughes.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which a team of five friends answers questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as rugby player Shane Williams, Coronation Street's Sair Khan, comedian Milton Jones and former Paralympic athlete Tanni Grey-Thompson pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway
programme.desc: The popular duo return with another edition of the Saturday evening variety show. Tom Jones will be taking to the stage to perform on this week's End of The Show Show, while Bradley Walsh becomes the first repeat victim of Undercover when Ant and Dec invade an episode of The Chase. Plus, keep an eye out for Fleur East, who has another Place on the Plane to give away.

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: Emma Willis hosts the second Knockout round, as 12 acts perform for a place in the live semi-final. Coaches Will.i.am, Tom Jones, Olly Murs and Meghan Trainor are in the red chairs as the acts they have chosen from the blind auditions and the Battle Rounds fight for a place on their coach's team.

programme.title: Knocked Up (2007)
programme.desc: Ambitious journalist Alison's one-night stand with directionless layabout Ben has unexpected consequences when she discovers she is pregnant. However, the unlikely parents-to-be decide to give the relationship a try for their baby's sake, forcing Ben to face the challenge of accepting responsibility for the first time in his life. Romantic comedy, starring Seth Rogen, Katherine Heigl and Paul Rudd.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How do they take a car from Siberia to the Sahara without leaving Germany? Plus, how do they hand craft a baseball glove that will last a lifetime?.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Edd China sets Mike Brewer the task of finding him a classic American truck. Mike heads to Sonoma County where he meets his first hipster and her Chevy LUV.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Meeting the people who drive some of the heaviest and least manoeuvrable vehicles along some of Australia's toughest highways.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: The team is commissioned to build a bike for Dodge Ram, and visits a farm to gain inspiration from real life.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: Daniel buys a 1968 Mustang Convertible and finds out that it looks a lot better than it drives. Plus, Dan transforms a problematic 1962 Citroen into a reliable ride.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe joins the assembly line in Idaho degreasing a train engine's blocks. Later, he gets behind the wheel and endeavours to keep the locomotive on the tracks.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.sub-title: Carbon Fibre/Antique Frame Restoration/Railcar Movers/Hood Ornaments
programme.desc: The development processed behind the creation of carbon fibre, railcar movers and hood ornaments. Plus, the techniques used in antique frame restoration.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: More everyday items are put under the microscope, this time examining how sawhorses and toolboxes, sorbet pops and school buses are made.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Jack prepares for the birth of his baby and Johnathan struggles with a rogue deckhand; meanwhile, Zack's dedication is called into question after a hydraulic explosion.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Auto enthusiast Mike Brewer and mechanic Edd China embark on a project to restore a classic 1.8-litre VW Mark 1 Golf GTi.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Mike Brewer and Edd China continue their project to get a 1.8-litre VW Mark 1 Golf GTi in prime condition to go back out on the road.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Edd China is stunned when Mike Brewer shows him his latest purchase, an unroadworthy VW Beetle, and decides to turn it into a beach buggy.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. The beach buggy project is completed and Edd China takes it for a test drive before Mike Brewer tries to sell it on for a profit.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer buys an old Lancia Delta Integrale, enlisting Edd China to fix the brakes and change the battery.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Edd China completes his work on the Lancia Delta Integrale, and Mike Brewer has no trouble in finding an eager buyer for the newly restored classic car.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Edd China begins renovation work on a 1984 Jeep CJ7, replacing the suspension and shock absorbers.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Edd China tries to fit the new rear drum brakes and completes a few other jobs, before Mike Brewer tries to sell the vehicle on for a profit.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Auto enthusiast Mike Brewer and mechanic Edd China tackle one of their biggest challenges to date - renovating an Audi Quattro.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Mike Brewer and Edd China continue with their Audi Quattro renovation project.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds a clean Subaru Impreza WRX at a good price, and hands it to Edd China to make it stand out by giving it a performance boost and changing its appearance.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer buys a G Wagen, a popular German 4x4. Mechanic Edd China spruces it up with a 2012 front end and rear lights, but it may not be enough for them to turn a profit.

programme.title: Cooper's Treasure
programme.desc: The previous season, Darrell Miklos located a shipwreck tied to Christopher Columbus using Cooper's intel. Now, he has eight weeks' of cash left to find another shipwreck that he can salvage.

programme.title: Houdini's Last Secrets
programme.desc: A team of experts recreates the famed bullet catch trick to uncover how Houdini could have accomplished it.

programme.title: Expedition Mungo
programme.sub-title: Living Dinosaur of Liberia: Expedition Mungo
programme.desc: Wildlife cameraman Paul 'Mungo' Mungeam profiles the Gbahali, a huge crocodilian creature that poses a threat to people living in Liberia.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Bushmen risk their lives in the fight to get their one-tonne digger down a 20-metre deep mine shaft. Plus, new alliances are forged as the Boulder Boys hit pay dirt.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer hopes to tap into 1990s nostalgia by working on an 1994 Mitsubishi 3000GT VR-4, but restoring the vehicle to its original state proves harder than expected.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard heads to Holland where, thanks to its thriving antiques markets, he can find the kind of unique pieces he's renowned for - including his dream car, a vintage Bugatti.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard unearths a steel corpus of Christ on the cross, and spots a divine early 19th-century gothic pew. Later, he finds a set of 1950s industrial pendant lamps.

programme.title: Disasters at Sea
programme.sub-title: The Sinking of the Lady Mary
programme.desc: In March 2009, scallop fishing boat the Lady Mary sank off the coast of New Jersey, killing six crew and leaving only one survivor. This edition explains how the tragedy occured.

programme.title: Mysteries of the Missing
programme.desc: Terry O'Quinn examines whether the tragic destruction of an Air France airliner in 2009 could ever happen again, and investigates deforestation in Siberian.

programme.title: Stars in Their Cars
programme.desc: Comedian Ross Noble escapes from the circus in a famous British runaround and bends the rules with a two-wheeled Japanese favourite.

programme.title: Stars in Their Cars
programme.desc: Comedian Alexei Sayle gets in a spot of bother in his unreliable Italian runaround, rediscovers a long-lost British classic and drives an off-road legend.

programme.title: The Lady Killers
programme.desc: Twenty eight-year-old Mahmuda Khatun stabbed her husband of only one month on his birthday. It was Khatun's second marriage arranged by her family and her defence lawyer suggested the stabbing arose out of cultural tensions. Here, detectives, experts and acquaintances discuss why they believe the optician's shop assistant murdered him.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An insight into how the latest techniques helped to find the murderer of a mother-of-two whose body was found 20 years earlier.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The discovery and identification of a human skull found in a Texas canyon with a single red hair, which led police to launch a manhunt when it was reconstructed.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: Emily Lambert went missing after spending the night at a hotel bar. Two days later, she was found murdered. Investigators set about tracking down her killer using CCTV.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of Timothy Moore, whose body was found in a shallow grave in April 2011, five months after he had been reported missing from his home in Washington's Willapa Bay. His son Devon later pleaded guilty to his murder.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The story of notorious bank robber Byron Chubbuck, who escaped from New Mexico State Penitentiary in 2000, and almost immediately began stealing again.

programme.title: Animal Cops Detroit
programme.desc: The team visits a house near Detroit that has become overrun by aggressive feral cats.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown must work out the best solution for a pup's badly deformed leg, a cat is brought in after being run over, and Tim and Julie are busy collecting koala dung.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Jennifer clashes with her mother over the dress budget, while Kate has a crisis involving a curved band of fabric.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: I Want My Daughter to Look Like a Sexpot
programme.desc: Randy arranges a surprise for his mother on her 93rd birthday, and a pregnant bride needs a dress that she can grow into.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A baby cockatoo has fallen out of its nest, so Sydney veterinary surgeon Dr Chris Brown tries to help it fly once again.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown fights to save Bluebell, who was dumped at the clinic as a kitten and has now fallen victim to a hit-and-run.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown goes on a dangerous mission to capture a monster python called Big Mamma.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A shih tzu needs an urgent transfusion when she begins bleeding from her bowel.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part one of two. Benji fears he will suffer the same fate as older brother David, who is now 700lbs. They embark on their weight loss journey together.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part one of two. Benji fears he will suffer the same fate as older brother David, who is now 700lbs. They embark on their weight loss journey together.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: The story of 30-year-old Joe, who must find the strength to face his past after losing his job and ending up mostly housebound.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: The story of 42-year-old Angel, who is struggling to make a positive change and be an active part of her partner and son's lives.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.sub-title: Michele Whitaker: The Last Truck Stop
programme.desc: The disappearance of Michele Whitaker who vanished in August 2002 after hitching a ride from a South Carolina truck stop. Convinced no one would be troubled at her departure, she made a new life on America's west coast, and only contacted relatives after a friend made her aware of a missing persons inquiry in her name six years later.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Visiting the bridal salon today are Dale, who has been waiting 30 years for her dream wedding, and Rachael, who wants to find a princess dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Same sex couple Meighan and Christina are looking for gowns that are individually flattering but complement each other. Will they both find their dream dress?.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Katherine and Sophie from reality series DC Cupcakes begin their search for Katherine's dream wedding dress, while Suzy and her sister seek an outfit they both love.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: The Devil Is in the Details
programme.desc: Niche wants a fashionable gown but her mother prefers the traditional look, while a bride with a specific style in mind struggles to find her dream dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: Too Many Cooks in the Kitchen
programme.desc: Cake Boss Buddy Valastro's wife Lisa searches for the perfect dress for their vow renewal, but she is torn between two gowns.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Tamika tries to stay within her budget on the hunt for a gown, while Ashley finds the perfect princess dress, but the price may be a little too high.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Three brides search for the perfect dress, including Elona, who has recently overcome huge obstacles, and Courtney, who brings along her mother to help.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Marjorie has enlisted her loved ones to help find a dress for her wedding in two months, while bride-to-be Lynette is at odds with her family and friends.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa Caputo performs readings for celebrities, including Kelsey Grammer and Sugar Ray singer Mark McGrath.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa celebrates her 50th birthday by entering a weightlifting competition, and performs a reading for a woman who claims her brother was murdered by an American football player.

programme.title: Hoarding: Buried Alive
programme.sub-title: A VCR for Every Day of the Week
programme.desc: The story of John, who faces jail for his compulsion, and his son Joe, who could lose his baby to child-protective services.

programme.title: Dr G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: The doctor tries to piece together the evidence that will determine exactly what happened when a 43-year-old man took a nap at his parents' house, and was later found dead in bed. Plus, a 53-year-old woman found dead on her sofa.

programme.title: Copycat Killers
programme.desc: The previously untold real-life copycat crimes and criminals inspired by blockbuster movies and TV shows. This instalment focuses on the undue influence of the movie Heathers.

programme.title: Dead of Winter
programme.desc: A mother and her two young children mysteriously go missing. Then, two local boys nearby also disappear. Is there a serial predator on the loose in rural Missouri?.
